SP.content: style advances as spur: 1) prow of sailing vessel, rostrum, cleaving hostile surface of sea 2) rocky point, also éperon, on which waves break at harbor’s entrance
SP.linkedContent: style advances as spur: 1) prow of sailing vessel, rostrum, cleaving hostile surface of sea 2) rocky point, also éperon, on which waves break at harbor’s entrance

SP.content: déjà, nom de ce qui s’efface ou d’avance se soustrait, laissant néanmoins une marque, une signature soustraite dans cela même don il se retire > style uses spur to protect against this subtraction
SP.linkedContent: déjà, nom de ce qui s’efface ou d’avance se soustrait, laissant néanmoins une marque, une signature soustraite dans cela même don il se retire > style uses spur to protect against this subtraction

SP.content: [it is impossible, and the English translation, I believe, fails to convey this, to tell whether the spur protects against presence or the threat to presence]
SP.linkedContent: [it is impossible, and the English translation, I believe, fails to convey this, to tell whether the spur protects against presence or the threat to presence]

SP.content: spur, sporo, spor, to spurn [in Mallarmé], word, trace, wake, indication, mark
SP.linkedContent: spur, sporo, spor, to spurn [in Mallarmé], word, trace, wake, indication, mark

SP.content: style-spur (le style éperonnant) as oblong object w/ its tissues, webs, sails, veils, thus its apotropaic power > also an umbrella
SP.linkedContent: style-spur (le style éperonnant) as oblong object w/ its tissues, webs, sails, veils, thus its apotropaic power > also an umbrella

SP.content: what impresses mark of stylate spur in question of woman? this doesn’t concern la figure de la femme: question of figure open and closed by “woman” > concerns instead her abduction (s’enlever)
SP.linkedContent: what impresses mark of stylate spur in question of woman? this doesn’t concern la figure de la femme: question of figure open and closed by “woman” > concerns instead her abduction (s’enlever)

SP.content: Derrida reads éperons, the cliffs (feet), in Nietzsche’s “here I stand in the midst des Brandes der Brandung (of the surging of the breakers)”
SP.linkedContent: Derrida reads éperons, the cliffs (feet), in Nietzsche’s “here I stand in the midst des Brandes der Brandung (of the surging of the breakers)”

SP.content: question of style, spurring-operation, more powerful than thesis, meaning: stylate spur rips through veil, to show the veil, to undo opposition veil/unveiled (sailed/unsailed) [voilé/dévoilé]
SP.linkedContent: question of style, spurring-operation, more powerful than thesis, meaning: stylate spur rips through veil, to show the veil, to undo opposition veil/unveiled (sailed/unsailed) [voilé/dévoilé]

SP.content: umbrella’s symbolic figure: hermaphroditic spur of a phallus (modestly folded dans ses voiles) > aggressive/apotropaic à la fois threatening/threatened
SP.linkedContent: umbrella’s symbolic figure: hermaphroditic spur of a phallus (modestly folded dans ses voiles) > aggressive/apotropaic à la fois threatening/threatened

SP.content: plus d’un spur, never been the woman > if there’s going to be style, pour que le simulacrum advienne, il faut écrire dans l’écart entre plusieurs styles: anchor lost in abyss btwn—telle est l’échéance
SP.linkedContent: plus d’un spur, never been the woman > if there’s going to be style, pour que le simulacrum advienne, il faut écrire dans l’écart entre plusieurs styles: anchor lost in abyss btwn—telle est l’échéance

REST.content: I meant “escape (évasion)” by overflowing pictorial limit, framed representation, visible immediacy (if any such thing exists, in the picture) w/ collar flared (au col évasé), half-inside out > isn’t this overflowing the discursive operation, from its very first word? or is its internal reason in pictorial structure? > question of structure of this limit, of being-in or being-out, question of supplement of parergon—once “escape” takes off (prendre son appel sur) from impoverished descriptive trait: no longer concerns a painting
REST.linkedContent: I meant “escape (évasion)” by overflowing pictorial limit, framed representation, visible immediacy (if any such thing exists, in the picture) w/ collar flared (au col évasé), half-inside out > isn’t this overflowing the discursive operation, from its very first word? or is its internal reason in pictorial structure? > question of structure of this limit, of being-in or being-out, question of supplement of parergon—once “escape” takes off (prendre son appel sur) from impoverished descriptive trait: no longer concerns a painting

CHOR.content: some can’t see beyond end of phallic forms in SP (bisexual complication of style, spur, umbrella): those people do not read the syntax and punctuation of a given sentence, arresting the text in a position, settling on a thesis, meaning or truth
